answers.answer: Yes this one physically is a lot harder but this one has been easier compared to my first. I was sick the whole time with my daughter. My son I'm just physically wore out and still have 7 weeks. I was also 24 with my daughter and now 30 with my son so it could be my age lol.

Yes this one physically is a lot harder but this one has been easier compared to my first. I was sick the whole time with my daughter. My son I'm just physically wore out and still have 7 weeks. I was also 24 with my daughter and now 30 with my son so it could be my age lol.

I TOTALLY AGREE! I was 24 when I had my daughter. I had no pregnancy symptoms til I was SIX MONTHS. With this pregnancy it was immediate. I notice my body changing from day one and all the text book symptoms. I'm due at the end of Jan also and feel like I'm only gonna make it til Dec. I developed preeclampsia with my first and was in labor at 35 weeks. So hopefully that won't happen with this pregnancy. But who knows. I hope the time speeds up for both of us. And best wishes.

Yesssss! This pregnancy has physically wore me out. With my first it felt like I went through my pregnancy like nothing and this one I was sick in the beginning my body is constantly aching and I feel so tired and miserable all the time. But like the commwnt said above me maybe its because I was 23 when I had my first and now I'm 28 lol.

Yess! With My daughter I was great, just swelling. Had her at age 22, now with our second at age 25, my back,hips,legs and ribs are in so much pain! Im unbelievably exhausted,yet never sleep. Maybe its cause it's second pregnancy, abd knowing how it goes, not the "o this is a brand new experience/excitement "? vs age?
I still have 7weeks left and have been homebound from work for almost a month, cause of complications :(
Ugh I am right there with you. I'll be 35 weeks Sunday and I'm so drained and sore. I'm literally miserable. I cannot wait to have this baby.

Oddly enough I've been both less tired and symptomatic this pregnancy, it's way easer than it was with my three year old. I'm still tired, but not as bad as the first time round. That  being said, the pelvic pain and lower back pain kicked in much earlier and oof!

Omw I am glad I'm not the only one. With first baby and she's 10months it was a breeze even having her wasn't that bad. But with this pregnancy I gabe been so sick and hips and legs hurt and I'm only 4 months.  Yes this baby is a surprise but that's ok. We prayed 3 1/2yrs for our first one.

question: Anyone else finding  second  pregnancy  much harder physically?  My back, hips, legs  and pelvic bone are constantly  sore. I still have 10 weeks to go and dont even know how i will make it to January!
title: Second  pregnancy!
